qas.question: What aspects of buildings did science and engineering have an effect on?
Who still could handle the structural calculations for designing at that time?
What aspects of buildings did engineering not have an effect on?
What aspects of buildings did science not have an effect on?
Who still couldn't handle the structural calculations for designing at that time?

context: A revival of the Classical style in architecture was accompanied by a burgeoning of science and engineering which affected the <a0_0><b2_0><b3_0>proportions and structure<b3_0/><b2_0/><a0_0/> of buildings. At this stage, it was still possible for an artist to design a bridge as the level of structural calculations involved was within the scope of the <a1_0><b4_0>generalist<b4_0/><a1_0/>.
